ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Are slow horses worth getting?
ygData.msgSnippet: I have cheapies for every caster and hybrid alt I play any reasonable amount, down to a 28 beastie who gets 3 hours every 6 months or so and a month old 15 SK
ygData.messageBody:
I have cheapies for every caster and hybrid alt I play any reasonable
amount, down to a 28 beastie who gets 3 hours every 6 months or so and a
month old 15 SK with about 8 hours played. Put simply, I think they're
absolutely priceless, tactically. I originally just had one for my druid to
make changing spells and medding while PLing easier, but I decided to try
one on my ranger to see how it went and I've stayed with it from there. I'm
pretty evenly split bt droggies and horses, and which sort for which style,
medding only or meleeing as well. I generally choose based on looks, and can
melee just as well from either when needed. I think it speeds things up
immeasurably, especially when there's no mind buffage to be had, and I can't
even begin to count how many times I lived bc I could use the horse to
switch spells while being hit, or to avoid being hit in the first place from
sit aggro.

In short...it's worth it.
----- Original Message -----
From: Melanie <snoopy66@...>
To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, July 02, 2005 8:14 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Are slow horses worth getting?


> When I still played, I had a cheap horse for my cleric. They are good
> for "medding while standing" so you can get that heal off quicker. But
> I rarely rode the horse. I just sat on it while fighting. If we moved
> our camp spot, I got off the horse, because SoW and SoE were faster.
>
> mushuplus wrote:
>
> >They look fun to ride on, but i don't think they are worth it because
> >on my friend's account he has a cheap drog and then i found out the
> >cheap ones are slow =P lol. Are the horses the same? All the things
> >the cheap ones do is make you look rich.
> >
